__TOC__



This week's Hug Day will focus on '''OpenOffice.org'''! There is some documentation on debugging these bugs at <nowiki>[[DebuggingOpenOffice]]</nowiki>.  The goal of today's bug day will be to provide better overall experience with the most popular Office Productivity Suite.

After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after '''rowbgcolor='''.  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.

=== 5-a-day-ing ===
During hug days you can also do <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day|5-A-Day]]</nowiki> for this one you can do the following in order to tag your work on the hug day:

* 5-a-day --add-tag hugday-20080930
* Add bugs to 5-a-day as usual
* And when done with hug day run: 5-a-day --remove-tag hugday-20080930

=== Bug tagging ===
<nowiki>[[BrianMurray| Brian Murray]]</nowiki> has written a <nowiki>[[http://people.ubuntu.com/~brian/greasemonkey/lp_buttontags_openoffice.org.user.js|variation]]</nowiki> of the lp_buttontags greasemonkey script specifically for this Hug Day.  It will add hyperlinks for commonly used tags for openoffice bug reports and can be installed in addition to lp_buttontags. 

=== Stock Responses ===

Some bug reports deal with compatability between `OpenOffice.org` and other office application document formats.  However, not everyone has access to these applications so it is quite helpful for bug reports to have a test document attached to them.  In the event that a bug report does not have a test document and could use one, please ask for it!

For problem specific Stock Responses see: <nowiki>[[Bugs-Responses]]</nowiki>

=== 166 New Bugs ===
'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Verify the bug is still not fixed
* Request any needed info, Subscribe, Status to incomplete '''or'''
* Set status to Confirmed
